main event: A celestial phenomenon was sighted by the Coast Guard while anchored in the Mississippi River near Donaldsonville, Louisiana.
interesting points: The object appeared as a brilliant glow of circular shape on the eastern horizon, bearing 090 degrees from the anchored position.
The object descended to approximately 3,000 feet and made a ragged circular course, leaving huge vapor trails.
The object then disappeared on an inclined course, traveling south at high speed.
The sighting occurred under clear skies with 5 miles of visibility and cloud banks.
The report was sent as an unclassified message to various military commands.
sighted object: a celestial phenomenon with a circular shape and brilliant glow
